values.title: When I load multisense_sl_cpu.urdf I cannot run stereo_vision

content.raw:
Greetings,

Running Ubuntu 12.04 with ROS Hydro, DRCSim 4, and Gazebo 4. 

For some reason I cannot visualize the laser in Rviz when I load `.../urdf/multisense_sl_v3.urdf`, only when I run `../urdf/multisense_sl_cpu.urdf`

However, when I load the latter, I am not able to run the stereo_view node in the image_view package successfully. 

When using image_view, I can successfully display a `/multisense_sl/left_or_right/image_raw`, but not the `/multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color`. 

I.e. 

```
rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color
```

The error displayed is:

```
Failed to load module "pk-gtk-module"
[ INFO] [1420685258.108389488]: Subscribing to:
	* /multisense/camera/left/image_rect_color
	* /multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color
	* /multisense/camera/disparity

[ WARN] [1420685318.651465493, 344.310000000]: [stereo_view] Low number of synchronized left/right/disparity triplets received.
Left images received:      0 (topic '/multisense/camera/left/image_rect_color')
Right images received:     0 (topic '/multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color')
Disparity images received: 0 (topic '/multisense/camera/disparity')
Synchronized triplets: 0

Possible issues:
	* stereo_image_proc is not running.
	  Does `rosnode info /stereo_view_1420685258015073382` show any connections?
	* The cameras are not synchronized.
	  Try restarting stereo_view with parameter _approximate_sync:=True
	* The network is too slow. One or more images are dropped from each triplet.
	  Try restarting stereo_view, increasing parameter 'queue_size' (currently 5)
```

I tried some of the suggestions from above, namely:

```
rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color _approximate_sync:=True
```

```
rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color _queue_size:=10
```

```
rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_cor _approximate_sync:=True _queue_size:=20
```

But nothing seems to work.
content.html:
Greetings,

Running Ubuntu 12.04 with ROS Hydro, DRCSim 4, and Gazebo 4.

For some reason I cannot visualize the laser in Rviz when I load .../urdf/multisense_sl_v3.urdf, only when I run ../urdf/multisense_sl_cpu.urdf

However, when I load the latter, I am not able to run the stereo_view node in the image_view package successfully.

When using image_view, I can successfully display a /multisense_sl/left_or_right/image_raw, but not the /multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color.

I.e. 

rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color

The error displayed is:

Failed to load module "pk-gtk-module"
[ INFO] [1420685258.108389488]: Subscribing to:
    * /multisense/camera/left/image_rect_color
    * /multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color
    * /multisense/camera/disparity

[ WARN] [1420685318.651465493, 344.310000000]: [stereo_view] Low number of synchronized left/right/disparity triplets received.
Left images received:      0 (topic '/multisense/camera/left/image_rect_color')
Right images received:     0 (topic '/multisense/camera/right/image_rect_color')
Disparity images received: 0 (topic '/multisense/camera/disparity')
Synchronized triplets: 0

Possible issues:
    * stereo_image_proc is not running.
      Does `rosnode info /stereo_view_1420685258015073382` show any connections?
    * The cameras are not synchronized.
      Try restarting stereo_view with parameter _approximate_sync:=True
    * The network is too slow. One or more images are dropped from each triplet.
      Try restarting stereo_view, increasing parameter 'queue_size' (currently 5)

I tried some of the suggestions from above, namely:

rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color _approximate_sync:=True

rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_color _queue_size:=10

rosrun image_view stereo_view stereo:=/multisense/camera image:=image_rect_cor _approximate_sync:=True _queue_size:=20

But nothing seems to work.
